review: The Fire TV Stick is okay.When it works well, it does everything that I want it to do. The inclusion of Prime videos is kind of disjointed. There's no real rhyme or reason to what it throws at you in terms of suggestions. Amazon could learn a lesson from Netflix in that way.But my primary complaint is that the device has a horrible time staying connected to wifi. I have a dual band router that the fire TV stick is no more than 2 feet away from. It won't stay connected to the 5 GHz signal at all, and it will go periods of time where it constantly connects, disconnects, and reconnects to the 2.4 GHz signal over and over and over. Obviously any streaming content is useless with this happening. All the while, none of the other devices on my network are having this problem. My Chromecast performs much better.Ultimately, I bought this device for Sling TV and have enjoyed easier access to the Prime instant video collection, and for those two uses, it's nice. But it doesn't work as well as I'd like, and as soon as my Chromecast gets Sling TV support, I will be moving on from this device.
